lines.text: We brought you along because you're supposed to be the big man with the iron; but I think now I could even out pull you.
You're probably right, Bob. You probably could put six in me by the time I put that one into you.
You got a lot of guts, ain't you kid?
You're the one with the gut Lon.
You may be a one eyed jack around here, but I've seen the other side of your face.
Get up! Get up, you scum suckin' pig!

[referring to Rio's busted gun hand]
It's been six weeks. That hand ain't gettin' no better. I say we lay for Longworth with shotguns and then go rob that bank.
Ambushin' folks ain't exactly my style, Bob.
I'd say your style's gettin' a bit slow. We brought you along because you're supposed to be the big man with the iron; but now, I think I could even out pull you.

[Putting his hand on his gun butt]
You're probably right, Bob. You probably could get six into me by the time I get that one into you.
Harvey Johnson's gonna be a famous name in these parts.
How's that?
He's about to get hisself killed by a fella named Rio.
That ain't him.
I wouldn't want to lose me a handful of brains trying to find out.
You've been tryin' to get yourself hung for the last fifteen years Kid. This time I think you might have made it.
What about Longworth?
Nothin' about him. In the mornin' I'll kill him and then we'll rob that bank.
You ain't gettin' no older than tomorrow.
[Longworth has tied up and whipped Rio]
You better kill me.
No, there's no need for that.
[smashes Rio's gun hand with a shotgun butt]
Your gun days are over. Put him on a horse.
You think that to kill him, will make you a man?
Well, I don't know 'bout that. But I know that I thought about him every day for five years. And that was the only thing that kept me going.
This is part that's goin' to tickle you; the sheriff in that town is named Dad Longworth.
[Rio has just bluffed his way out of jail with an empty pistol]
Looky here, Lon; wasn't loaded.
[Modesto is attempting to stop Bob from double crossing Rio]
I'm real disappointed in you, Modesto; pullin' a gun on an old saddle pal like that.
One more word and I will kill you!
One more word, huh? Let me see if I can think of one. How about g-r-e-a-s-e-r? Greaser?
[Modesto pulls his trigger and realizes that Bob has unloaded his gun during the night]
Lookin' for these, Modesto? (throws cartridges at him)
(laughing) Eat 'em, greaser.
(throws his gun at Bob)Banditos!
You had a good life, Modesto. (shoots him)
I don't know, Dad. You may not want me around too long. You may be retired from robbin' banks, Dad; but I'm still in business.
[Bob and Harvey are watching Longworth whip Rio]
We better get down there and do something.
Do something? Not this old horse; Longworth's got enough shotguns down there to start a war. Besides, this might help get some of that snot-nose out of him.
Get up, you big tub of guts!
